721047f-a.text:
Lexington Ave., west side, north from East 67th to 68th Streets, showing the Institution for Deaf Mutes occupying this entire block front. This photograph taken after the "Great Blizzard" shows on the right, buildings at the N.W. corner of the avenue and 68th Street. These are units of the former Teachers (Normal) College and have been replaced
by Thomas Hunter Hall (unit of Hunter College).
March 14, 1888.
Ewing Galloway.

714210f-a.text:
67th Street, at, adjoining and east of the 8.E. Corner of Lexington Ave.
May 19, 1922g
Wurts Brothers.
Gift of E. M. Jenks.

block front from East 67th to 68th Streets.
June 12, 1937.

June 18, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.

714204f-a.text:
157th East 67th Street, between Lexington and Third Avenue former site, Fire Engine house now Attendance Bureau and
Supply Department.
Board of Education, N.Y.C.
Neg at I094

1507598.title: Lexington Avenue - 67th Street - 68th Street looking south
1507598.folder: Lexington Avenue - 67th Street - 68th Street looking south, Manhattan, NY

721046f-a.text:
Crowd assembled at Lexington Avenue and E.67th Street to witness the digging of the first shovelful of earth taken up for the construction of the city's projected subway system. The Total cost of the new subways will be $257,000,000.
n.d.American Press Assn.
